item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William Hazlitt
item.description: "The love of liberty is the love of others; the love of power is the love of ourselves. (1778 - 1830)" -- William Hazlitt

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Loyalty to country ALWAYS. Loyalty to government, when it deserves it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Seven Deadly Sins
Wealth without work Pleasure without conscience Science without humanity Knowledge without character Politics without principle Commerce without morality Worship without sacrifice." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Political language is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind. " -- George Orwell

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "If our Founding Fathers wanted us to care about the rest of the world, they wouldn't have declared their independence from it." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I predict future happiness for Americans, if they can prevent the government from wasting the labors of the people under the pretense of taking care of them." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Pericles
item.description: "Just because you do not take an interest in politics doesn't mean politics won't take an interest in you. " -- Pericles

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile, hoping it will eat him last." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I know no safe depository of the ultimate powers of the society but the people themselves ; and if we think them not enlightened enough to exercise their control with a wholesome discretion, the remedy is not to take it from them, but to inform their discretion by education. This is the true corrective of abuses of constitutional power." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Show me a young Conservative and I'll show you someone with no heart. Show me an old Liberal and I'll show you someone with no brains." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Patrick Henry
item.description: "The Constitution is not an instrument for the government to restrain the people, it is an instrument for the people to restrain the government - lest it come to dominate our lives and interests." -- Patrick Henry

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Adams
item.description: "While our country remains untainted with the principles and manners which are now producing desolation in so many parts of the world; while she continues sincere, and incapable of insidious and impious policy, we shall have the strongest reason to rejoice our local destination. But should the people of America once become capable of that deep simulation towards one another, and towards foreign nations, which assumes the language of justice and moderation, while it is practising iniquity and extravagance, and displays in the most captivating manner the charming pictures of candour, frankness, and sincerity, while it is rioting in rapine and insolence, this country will be the most miserable habitation in the world." -- John Adams

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as a Michaelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, 'Here lived a great street sweeper who did his job well." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Example is not the main thing in influencing others. It is the only thing." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neal A. Maxwell
item.description: "Let us have integrity and not write checks with our tongues which our conduct cannot cash." -- Neal A. Maxwell

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William J.H. Boetcker
item.description: "You cannot help the poor by destroying the rich. You cannot strengthen the weak by weakening the strong. You cannot bring about prosperity by discouraging thrift. You cannot lift the wage earner up by pulling the wage payer down. You cannot further the brotherhood of man by inciting class hatred. You cannot build character and courage by taking away men's initiative and independence. You cannot help men permanently by doing for them, what they could and should do for themselves." -- William J.H. Boetcker

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I am a slow walker, but I never walk back." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "It is said an Eastern monarch once charged his wise men to invent him a sentence to be ever in view, and which should be true and appropriate in all times and situations. They presented him the words, "And this too, shall pass away." How much it expresses! How chastening in the hour of pride! How consoling in the depths of affliction!" -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "I've noticed that everyone who is for abortion has already been born." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "That which we persist in doing becomes easier to do, not that the nature of the thing has changed but that our power to do has increased." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
